article.heading: Properties
article.paragraph: The geometric mean of two positive numbers is never bigger than the arithmetic mean (seeinequality of arithmetic and geometric means); as a consequence,math(''gn'')is an increasing sequence,math(''an'')is a decreasing sequence, andmath''gn'' ≤ ''M''(''x'', ''y'') ≤ ''an''. These are strict inequalities ifmath''x'' ≠ ''y''.
math''M''(''x'', ''y'')is thus a number between the geometric and arithmetic mean ofmath''x''andmath''y''; in particular it is betweenmath''x''andmath''y''.
